newsitem.title: UK: European jet fuel dragged up by stronger futures.
newsitem.headline: European jet fuel dragged up by stronger futures.

text.p: European jet fuel was pulled higher by futures on Thursday amid steady premiums in a slow day.
May IPE gas oil closed $1.50 a tonne stronger at $169.00.
Traders said business was sparse with much of continental Europe on holiday.
A barge traded at May IPE +$20.25 fob ARA, unchanged from the last few days, while cargoes were struggling to find buyers.
Offers of May IPE +$21 cif NWE were failing to generate any appreciable interest.
Dealers said the northern European jet market was long, but not in ARA, hence barges' relative strength against the cargo market.
The buy tender by German compulsory stocks agency EBV was also giving some support to the barge market.
Up to four Mediterranean cargoes were headed northwards because of the lack of selling opportunity in their home region.
Jet paper was also slow with balance of May offered at $21.50, June offered at $22.50 and 3Q at $26.00. There were no takers.
